statements.name: PROC PROBIT
statements.description: The PROBIT procedure calculates maximum likelihood estimates of regression parameters and the natural (or threshold) response rate for quantal response data from biological assays or other discrete event data. This includes probit, logit, ordinal logistic, and extreme value (or gompit) regression models. † Probit analysis developed from the need to analyze qualitative (dichotomous or polytomous) dependent variables within the regression framework. Many response variables are binary by nature (yes/no), while others are measured ordinally rather than continuously (degree of severity). Collett (2003) and Agresti (2002), for example, have shown ordinary least squares (OLS) regression to be inadequate when the dependent variable is discrete. Probit or logit analyses are more appropriate in this case.

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: Sets the natural response rate or to provide the initial estimate of the natural response rate. The natural response rate value must be a number between 0 and 1.

arguments.name: CVOUT
arguments.description: Writes the parameter estimate covariance matrix to the OUTEST= data set.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the SAS data set to be used by PROC PROBIT.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies a graphics catalog in which to save graphics output.

arguments.name: HPROB=
arguments.description: Specifies a minimum probability level for the Pearson chi-square to indicate a good fit. The default value is 0.10.

arguments.name: INEST=
arguments.description: Specifies an input SAS data set that contains initial estimates for all the parameters in the model.

arguments.name: INVERSECL
arguments.description: Computes confidence limits for the values of the first continuous independent variable (such as dose) that yield selected response rates.

arguments.name: LACKFIT
arguments.description: Performs two goodness-of-fit tests (a Pearson chi-square test and a log-likelihood ratio chi-square test) for the fitted model.

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Analyzes the data by replacing the first continuous independent variable with its natural logarithm.

arguments.name: LOG10
arguments.description: Specifies an analysis like that of the LN or LOG option, except that the common logarithm (log to the base 10) of the dose value is used rather than the natural logarithm.

arguments.name: NAMELEN=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of effect names in tables and output data sets to be n-characters, where n is a value between 20 and 200. The default length is 20 characters.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of all output including graphics.

arguments.name: OPTC
arguments.description: Requests that the natural response rate C be estimated.

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the sorting order for the levels of the classification variables specified in the CLASS statement, including the levels of the response variable.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: OUTEST=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS data set to contain the parameter estimates and, if the COVOUT option is specified, their estimated covariances.

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Specifies options that control details of the plots created by ODS Graphics. Syntax: (1) PLOT | PLOTS <=plot-request> (2) PLOT | PLOTS <=(plot-request < ...plot-request > )>
arguments.help: PLOTS=ALL | CDFPLOT | IPPPLOT | LPREDPLOT | NONE | PREDPPLOT

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Creates all appropriate plots.

arguments.name: CDFPLOT
arguments.description: Syntax: CDFPLOT<(LEVEL=(character-list))> Requests the plot of predicted cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the multinomial response variable as a function of a single continuous independent variable (dose variable).

arguments.name: IPPPLOT
arguments.description: Requests the inverse plot of the predicted probability against the first single continuous variable (dose variable) in the MODEL statement for the binomial model.

arguments.name: LPREDPLOT
arguments.description: Syntax: LPREDPLOT<(LEVEL=(character-list))> Requests the plot of the linear predictor x'b against the first single continuous variable (dose variable) in the MODEL statement for either the binomial model or the multinomial model.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all plots.

arguments.name: PREDPPLOT
arguments.description: Syntax: PREDPPLOT<(LEVEL=(character-list))> Requests the plot of the predicted probability against the first single continuous variable (dose variable) in the MODEL statement for both the binomial model and the multinomial model.

arguments.name: XDATA=
arguments.description: Specifies an input SAS data set that contains values for all the independent variables in the MODEL statement and variables in the CLASS statement.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: You can specify a BY statement with PROC PROBIT to obtain separate analyses on observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables. When a BY statement appears, the procedure expects the input data set to be sorted in order of the BY variables. If you specify more than one BY statement, only the last one specified is used.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: CDFPLOT
statements.description: The CDFPLOT statement plots the predicted cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the multinomial response variable as a function of a single continuous independent variable (dose variable). You can use this statement only after a multinomial model statement

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an Annotate data set that enables you to add features to the CDF plot. The ANNOTATE= data set you specify in the CDFPLOT statement is used for all plots created by the statement.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color used for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications in an AXIS statement. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CFIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the fitted CDF curves. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not shaded by default.

arguments.name: CGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for grid lines. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CLABBOX=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area enclosed by the label box for CDF curves. This area is not shaded by default.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description, up to 40 characters, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default is the variable name.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies tick mark values for the horizontal axis; value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, and value1 must be less than value2. The lower tick mark is value1. Tick marks are drawn at increments of value3. The last tick mark is the greatest value that does not exceed value2. If value3 is omitted, a value of 1 is used.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of text used outside framed areas. The default value is 3.846 (in percentage).

arguments.name: HLOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower limit on the horizontal axis scale. The HLOWER= option specifies value as the lower horizontal axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically. This option has no effect if the HAXIS= option is used.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies offset for horizontal axis. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: HREF
arguments.description: Requests reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal axis. If (INTERSECT) is specified, a second reference line perpendicular to the vertical axis is drawn that intersects the fit line at the same point as the horizontal axis reference line. If a horizontal axis reference line label is specified, the intersecting vertical axis reference line is labeled with the vertical axis value.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.
Top of plot
Staggered from top
Bottom of plot
Staggered from bottom
Alternating from top
Alternating from bottom

arguments.name: HUPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies value as the upper horizontal axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower axis limit are determined automatically. This option has no effect if the HAXIS= option is used.

arguments.name: INBORDER
arguments.description: Requests a border around CDF plots.

arguments.name: LEVEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the names of the levels for which CDF curves are requested. Names should be quoted and separated by space. If there is no correct name provided, no CDF curve is plotted.

arguments.name: LFIT=
arguments.description: Specifies a line style for fitted curves. By default, fitted curves are drawn by connecting solid lines (linetype = 1).

arguments.name: LGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies a line style for all grid lines. linetype is between 1 and 46. The default is 35.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default value is 'PROBIT'.

arguments.name: NOFIT
arguments.description: Suppresses the fitted CDF curves.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around plotting areas.

arguments.name: NOGRID
arguments.description: Suppresses grid lines.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses horizontal labels.

arguments.name: NOHTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses horizontal tick marks.

arguments.name: NOTHRESH
arguments.description: Suppresses the threshold line.

arguments.name: NOVLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses vertical labels.

arguments.name: NOVTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses vertical tick marks.

arguments.name: THRESHLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of labels for the threshold line.
Labels are placed to the left of the plot.
Labels are placed to the right of the plot.

arguments.name: VAR=
arguments.description: Specifies a single continuous variable (dose variable) in the independent variable list of the MODEL statement. If a VAR= variable is not specified, the first single continuous variable in the independent variable list of the MODEL statement is used. If such a variable does not exist in the independent variable list of the MODEL statement, an error is reported.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies tick mark values for the vertical axis; value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, and value1 must be less than value2. The lower tick mark is value1. Tick marks are drawn at increments of value3. The last tick mark is the greatest value that does not exceed value2. This method of specification of tick marks is not valid for logarithmic axes. If value3 is omitted, a value of 1 is used.

arguments.name: VAXISLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VLOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower limit on the vertical axis scale. The VLOWER= option specifies value as the lower vertical axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically. This option has no effect if the VAXIS= option is used.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Requests reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis. If (INTERSECT) is specified, a second reference line perpendicular to the horizontal axis is drawn that intersects the fit line at the same point as the vertical axis reference line. If a vertical axis reference line label is specified, the intersecting horizontal axis reference line is labeled with the horizontal axis value.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of labels for VREF= lines.
Labels are positioned to the left of the plot.
Labels are positioned to the right of the plot.

arguments.name: VUPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper limit on the vertical axis scale. The VUPPER= option specifies value as the upper vertical axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower axis limit are determined automatically. This option has no effect if the VAXIS= option is used.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line thickness for axes and frame. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: WFIT=
arguments.description: Specifies line thickness for fitted curves. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: WGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies line thickness for grids. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: WREFL=
arguments.description: Specifies line thickness for reference lines. The default value is 1.

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: The CLASS statement names the classification variables to be used in the analysis. Classification variables can be either character or numeric. Observations with zero, negative, or missing weights are not used in model estimation.

statements.name: EFFECTPLOT
statements.description: The EFFECTPLOT statement produces a display of the fitted model and provides options for changing and enhancing the displays.

arguments.name: BOX=
arguments.description: Displays a box plot of continuous response data at each level of a CLASS effect, with predicted values superimposed and connected by a line. This is an alternative to the INTERACTION plot-type.

arguments.name: CONTOUR=
arguments.description: Displays a contour plot of predicted values against two continuous covariates.

arguments.name: FIT=
arguments.description: Displays a curve of predicted values versus a continuous variable.

arguments.name: INTERACTION=
arguments.description: Displays a curve of predicted values versus a continuous variable grouped by the levels of a CLASS effect.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the significance level, 0 ≥ value ≥ 1, for producing 100(1-value/2)% prediction and confidence limits. By default, value=0.05.

arguments.name: AT
arguments.description: where contopt= MEAN | MIN | MAX | MIDRANGE classopt= ALL | REF varopt= contopts | number-list | classopts | ’class-level’...’class-level’]

arguments.name: ATLEN=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum length (1 < n < 256) of the levels of the AT variables that are displayed in footnotes and headers. By default, up to 256 characters of the CLASS levels are displayed, and the continuous AT levels are displayed with a BEST format that has a width greater than or equal to 5, which distinguishes each level. Caution:If the levels of your AT variables are not unique when the first n characters are displayed, then the levels are combined in the plots but not in the underlying computations. Also, at most n characters for continuous AT variables are displayed.

arguments.name: ATORDER=
arguments.description: Uses the AT values for continuous variables in ascending or descending order as specified. By default, values are used in the order of their first appearance in the AT option.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: Uses the AT values for continuous variables in ascending order

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Uses the AT values for continuous variables in descending order

arguments.name: CLI
arguments.description: Displays normal (Wald) prediction limits. This option is available only for normal distributions with identity links. If your model is from a Bayesian analysis, then sampling-based intervals are computed.

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: Displays confidence limits. These are computed as the normal (Wald) confidence limits for the linear predictor, and if the ILINK option is specified, the limits are also back-transformed by the inverse link function. If your model is from a Bayesian analysis, then sampling-based intervals are computed.

arguments.name: CLUSTER
arguments.description: Modifies the BOX and INTERACTION plot-types by displaying the levels of the SLICEBY= effect in a side-by-side fashion. You can specify percent as a percentage of half the distance between X levels. The percent value must be between 0.1 and 1; the default percent depends on the number of X levels, the number of SLICEBY levels, and the number of PLOTBY levels for INTERACTION plot-types. Default clustering can be removed by specifying the NOCLUSTER option.

arguments.name: CONNECT
arguments.description: Modifies the BOX and INTERACTION plot-types by connecting the predicted values with a line. Default connecting lines can be removed by specifying the NOCONNECT option.

arguments.name: EXTEND=
arguments.description: Extends continuous covariate axes by value x ½range in both directions, where range is the range of the X axis.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Displays curves to the range of the data within the appropriate SLICEBY=, PLOTBY=, and AT level.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Replace <value> with an actual value.

arguments.name: GRIDSIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the resolution of curves by computing the predicted values at n equally spaced x-values and specifies the resolution of surfaces by computing the predicted values on an nxn grid of points. Default values are n=200 for curves and bands, n=50 for surfaces, and n=2 for lines. If results of a Bayesian or bootstrap analysis are being displayed, then the defaults are n=500000/B, where B is the number of samples, the upper limit is equal to the usual defaults, and the lower limit equal to 20.

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: Displays the fit on the scale of the inverse link function. In particular, the results are displayed on the probability scale for logistic regression. By default, a procedure displays the fit on either the link or inverse link scale.

arguments.name: INDIVIDUAL
arguments.description: Displays individual probabilities for polytomous response models with cumulative links on the scale of the inverse link function. This option is not available when the LINK option is specified, and confidence limits are not available with this option.

arguments.name: LIMITS
arguments.description: Invokes the CLI and CLM options.

arguments.name: LINK
arguments.description: Displays the fit on the scale of the link function; that is, the linear predictor. Note that probabilities or observed proportions near 0 and 1 are transformed to . By default, a procedure displays the fit on either the link or inverse link scale.

arguments.name: MOFF
arguments.description: Moves the offset for a Poisson regression model to the response side of the equation. If the ILINK option is also in effect, then the rate is displayed on the Y axis, while the LINK option displays the log of the rate on the Y axis. Without this option, the predicted values are computed and displayed only for the observations.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of columns in a paneled plot. This option is not available with the BOX plot-type. The default choice of NROWS= and NCOLS= is based on the number of PLOTBY= and AT levels. If there is only one plot being displayed in a panel, then NROWS=1 and NCOLS=1 and the plots are produced as if you specified only the UNPACK option. If only two plots are displayed in a panel, then NROWS=1 and NCOLS=2. For all other cases, a 2x2, 2x3, or 3x3 panel is chosen based on how much of the last panel is used, with ties going to the larger panels. For example, if 14 plots are being created, then this requires either four 2x2 panels with 50% of the last panel filled, three 2x3 panels with 33% of the last panel filled, or two 3x3 panels with 55% of the last panel filled; in this case, the 3x3 panels are chosen.

arguments.name: NOCLI
arguments.description: Suppresses the prediction limits.

arguments.name: NOCLM
arguments.description: Suppresses the confidence limits.

arguments.name: NOLIMITS
arguments.description: Invokes the NOCLI and NOCLM options.

arguments.name: NOOBS
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of observations and overrides the specification of the OBS= option.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of rows in a paneled plot. This option is not available with the BOX plot-type. See the NCOLS= option for more details.

arguments.name: OBS=
arguments.description: Displays observations on the effect plots. An input data set is required; hence the OBS option is not available with PROC PLM. The OBS option is overridden by the NOOBS option. When the ILINK option is specified with binary response variables, then either the observed proportions or a coded value of the response is displayed. For polytomous response variables, the observed values are overlaid onto the fitted curves unless the LOCATION= option is specified. Whether observations are displayed by default or not depends upon the procedure. If the PLOTBY= option is specified, then the observations displayed on each plot are from the corresponding PLOTBY= level for classification effects; for continuous effects, all observations are displayed on every plot. The following options are available: BYAT -- subsets the observations by AT level and by the PLOTBY= level. CDISPLAY=NONE | OUTLINE | GRADIENT | OUTLINEGRADIENT controls the display of observations on contour plots. CGRADIENT=RESIDUAL | DEPENDENT specifies what the gradient-shading of the observed values on the CONTOUR plot-type represents. DEPTH=depth (you can specify 1 ≤ depth ≤ 100. By default, DEPTH=1) specifies the number of overlapping observations that can be distinguished by adjusting their transparency. DISTANCE displays observations on FIT plot-types with a color-gradient that indicates how far the observation is from the AT and PLOTBY= level. FITATCLASS -- computes fitted values only for class levels that are observed in the data set. FRINGE -- displays observations in a fringe (rug) plot at the bottom of the plot. JITTER<(FACTOR=factor SEED=seed X=x-jitter Y=y-jitter)> -- shifts (jitters) the observations. LABEL<=OBS> -- labels markers with their observation number.
arguments.help: OBS=BYAT | CDISPLAY= | CGRADIENT= | DEPTH= | DISTANCE | FITATCLASS | FRINGE | JITTER | FACTOR= | SEED= | X= | Y= | LABEL | LABEL= | LOCATION=

arguments.name: PLOTBY=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable or CLASS effect at whose levels the predicted values are computed and the plots are displayed. You can specify the response variable as the effect for polytomous response models. The panel-type argument specifies the method in which the plots are grouped for the display. The following panel-types are available. COLUMNS specifies that the columns within each panel correspond to different levels of the PLOTBY= effect and hence the rows correspond to different AT levels. PACK specifies that plots be displayed in the panels as they are produced with no control over the placement of the PLOTBY= and AT levels. PANELS | LEVELS specifies that each level of the PLOTBY= effect begin a new panel of plots and the AT levels define the plots within the panels. ROWS specifies that the rows within each panel correspond to different levels of the PLOTBY= effect and hence the columns correspond to different AT levels.

arguments.name: PLOTBYLEN=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum length (1 ≤ n ≤ 256) of the levels of the PLOTBY= variables, which are displayed in footnotes and headers. By default, up to 256 characters of the CLASS levels are displayed.

arguments.name: POLYBAR
arguments.description: Displays polytomous response data as a stacked histogram with bar heights defined by the individual predicted value. Your response variable must be the SLICEBY= variable, and the INDIVIDUAL and ILINK options must be in effect; otherwise, the option is ignored. Confidence limits are ignored.

arguments.name: PREDLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label to be displayed on the Y axis. The default Y axis label is determined by your model. For the CONTOUR plot-type, this option changes the title to "label for Y."

arguments.name: SHOWCLEGEND
arguments.description: Displays the gradient-legend for the CONTOUR plot-type. This option has no effect when the OBS(CGRADIENT=RESIDUAL) option is also specified.

arguments.name: SLICEBY=
arguments.description: Displays the fitted values at the different levels of the specified variable or CLASS effect.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Preventing the INTERACTION plot-type from slicing by a second class covariate. Note that the SLICEBY=NONE option is not available for the SLICEFIT plot-type, since that is the same as the FIT plot-type.

arguments.name: effect
arguments.description: You can specify the response variable as the effect for polytomous response models. Use this option to modify SLICEFIT and INTERACTION plot-types. If you specify a continuous variable as the effect, then you can either specify a numeric-list of values at which to display that variable or, by default, five equally spaced values from the minimum variable value to its maximum are displayed.

arguments.name: SMOOTH
arguments.description: Overlays a loess smooth on the FIT plot-type for models that have only one continuous predictor. This option is not available for binary or polytomous response models.

arguments.name: UNPACK
arguments.description: Suppresses paneling. By default, multiple plots can appear in some output panels. Specify UNPACK to display each plot separately.]

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: Specifies values to display on the X axis. For BOX and INTERACTION plot-types, effect can be a CLASS effect in the MODEL statement. For FIT, SLICEFIT, and CONTOUR plot-types, effect can be any continuous variable in the model.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: Specifies values to display on the Y axis for the CONTOUR plot-type. The Y= argument can be any continuous variable in the model.

arguments.name: YRANGE=
arguments.description: Displays the predicted values on the Y axis in the range [min,max]. By default, when the Y axis displays predicted probabilities, the entire Y axis, [0,1], is displayed. This option is useful if your predicted probabilities are all contained in some subset of this range. This option is not available with the CONTOUR plot-type.

arguments.name: CLIP
arguments.description: Has the same effect as specifying the minimum predicted value as min and the maximum predicted value as max.

arguments.name: <(<min><,max>)>
arguments.description: Replace min and max with actual values.

statements.name: ESTIMATE
statements.description: The ESTIMATE statement provides a mechanism for obtaining custom hypothesis tests.

arguments.name: ADJDFE=
arguments.description: Specifies how denominator degrees of freedom are determined when p-values and confidence limits are adjusted for multiple comparisons with the ADJUST= option.

arguments.name: SOURCE
arguments.description: The denominator degrees of freedom for multiplicity-adjusted results are the denominator degrees of freedom for the final effect listed in the ESTIMATE statement from the 'Type III Tests of Fixed Effects' table.

arguments.name: ROW
arguments.description: Useful if you want multiplicity adjustments to take into account that denominator degrees of freedom are not constant across estimates.

arguments.name: ADJUST=
arguments.description: Requests a multiple comparison adjustment for the p-values and confidence limits for the estimates.

arguments.name: BON
arguments.description: Bonferroni adjustment

arguments.name: SCHEFFE
arguments.description: Scheffe's adjustment

arguments.name: SIDAK
arguments.description: Sidak adjustment

arguments.name: SIMULATE
arguments.description: Computes adjusted p-values and confidence limits from the simulated distribution of the maximum or maximum absolute value of a multivariate t random vector.

arguments.name: T
arguments.description: The default, which really signifies no adjustment for multiple comparisons.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Requests that a t-type confidence interval be constructed with confidence level 1-number. The value of number must be between 0 and 1; the default is 0.05.

arguments.name: BYCATEGORY
arguments.description: Requests that in models for nominal data (generalized logit models) estimates be reported separately for each category.

arguments.name: CL
arguments.description: Requests that t-type confidence limits be constructed.

arguments.name: DF=
arguments.description: Specifies the degrees of freedom for the t test and confidence limits.

arguments.name: DIVISOR=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of values by which to divide the coefficients so that fractional coefficients can be entered as integer numerators.

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: Requests that the L matrix coefficients be displayed.

arguments.name: EXP
arguments.description: Requests exponentiation of the estimate.

arguments.name: GROUP
arguments.description: Sets up random-effect contrasts between different groups when a GROUP= variable appears in the RANDOM statement.

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: Requests that the estimate and its standard error are also reported on the scale of the mean (the inverse linked scale).

arguments.name: LOWER
arguments.description: Requests that the p-value for the t test be based only on values less than the test statistic.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Tunes the estimability checking as documented for the CONTRAST statement.

arguments.name: STEPDOWN
arguments.description: Requests that multiplicity adjustments for the p-values of estimates be further adjusted in a step-down fashion.

arguments.name: SUBJECT
arguments.description: Sets up random-effect contrasts between different subjects when a SUBJECT= variable appears in the RANDOM statement.

arguments.name: UPPER
arguments.description: Requests that the p-value for the t test be based only on values greater than the test statistic.

statements.name: INSET
statements.description: The box or table of summary information produced on plots made with the CDFPLOT, IPPPLOT, LPREDPLOT, or PREDPPLOT statement is called an inset. You can use the INSET statement to customize both the information that is printed in the inset in box and the appearance of the inset box. To supply the information that is displayed the inset box, you specify keywords corresponding to the information you want shown.

arguments.name: C
arguments.description: User-input threshold

arguments.name: CONFIDENCE
arguments.description: Confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals

arguments.name: DIST
arguments.description: Name of the distribution

arguments.name: NEVENTS
arguments.description: Number of events

arguments.name: NOBS
arguments.description: Number of observations

arguments.name: NRESPLEV
arguments.description: Number of levels of the response variable

arguments.name: NTRIALS
arguments.description: Number of trials

arguments.name: OPTC
arguments.description: Estimated natural threshold

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies color for filling box.

arguments.name: POS=
arguments.description: Determines the position of the inset. The value can be a compass point (N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW) or a pair of coordinates (x, y) enclosed in parentheses. The coordinates can be specified in axis percentage units or axis data units.

arguments.name: REFPOINT=

statements.name: IPPPLOT
statements.description: The IPPPLOT statement plots the inverse of the predicted probability against a single continuous variable (dose variable) in the MODEL statement for the binomial model. You can only use this statement after a binomial model statement. The confidence limits for the predicted values of the dose variable are the computed fiducial limits, not the inverse of the confidence limits of the predicted probabilities.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an Annotate data set that enables you to add features to the IPP plot. The ANNOTATE= data set you specify in the IPPPLOT statement is used for all plots created by the statement.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color used for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications in an AXIS statement. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CFIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the fitted IPP curves. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not shaded by default.

arguments.name: CGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for grid lines. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description, up to 40 characters, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default is the variable name.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies tick mark values for the horizontal axis; value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, and value1 must be less than value2. The lower tick mark is value1. Tick marks are drawn at increments of value3. The last tick mark is the greatest value that does not exceed value2. If value3 is omitted, a value of 1 is used.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of text used outside framed areas. The default value is 3.846 (in percentage).

arguments.name: HLOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower limit on the horizontal axis scale. The HLOWER= option specifies value as the lower horizontal axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically. This option has no effect if the HAXIS= option is used.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies offset for horizontal axis. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: HREF=
arguments.description: Requests reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal axis. If (INTERSECT) is specified, a second reference line perpendicular to the vertical axis is drawn that intersects the fit line at the same point as the horizontal axis reference line. If a horizontal axis reference line label is specified, the intersecting vertical axis reference line is labeled with the vertical axis value.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.
Top of plot

Bottom of plot

Alternating from bottom

arguments.name: HUPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies value as the upper horizontal axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower axis limit are determined automatically. This option has no effect if the HAXIS= option is used.

arguments.name: INBORDER
arguments.description: Requests a border around IPP plots.

arguments.name: LFIT=

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of labels for VREF= lines.

arguments.name: VUPPER=
